Description: Body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery amphora; interior reserved; exterior, cream slip: at top dividing band consisting of dot and billet pattern; below frieze of spaced stars with added purple; part of dotted rosette as filling ornament with added purple on dots.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Sherd is also published in CVA Oxford 2, II D, 85, no. 13, pl. VI.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (85, IId pl. 6, 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.074)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
